alert.note: Alert for Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mineral, southwestern Missoula and southwestern Sanders Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 838 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lookout Pass to 7 miles west of Superior to 9 miles southwest of Alberton. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thompson Falls, Superior, Alberton, De Borgia, St. Regis, Tarkio, Riverbend, Haugan, Paradise, Frenchtown, Ninemile, Lozeau, Huson, Quartz, Saltese, Keystone, East Portal, Taft, Cyr and Stark. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 86. Highway 200 W between mile markers 44 and 55, and between mile markers 81 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys
